riddle: I am a three-digit number. My tens digit is five more than my ones digit, and my hundreds digit is eight less than my tens digit. What number am I?
What number am I? I am twice the sum of my digits.
I am a number. Multiply me by 4 and subtract 6 to get 18. What am I?
The sum of two numbers is 20, and their product is 96. What are the numbers?
I am a number. If you double me and subtract 10, you get 14. What number am I?
The difference between two numbers is 6, and their sum is 14. What are the numbers?
I am a number. My square is 64, and my cube is 512. What am I?
I am a number. If you subtract 5 from me and then divide by 4, you get 3. What number am I?
I am a number. If you add me to myself, then multiply by 3, the result is 36. What am I?

If you subtract me from 25, you get 10. What number am I?
What number becomes double itself when added to 12?
Divide me by 7, and you get 3. What number am I?
If you multiply my digits, you get 24. If you add them, you get 11. What number am I?

If you multiply me by 5, you get 60. What am I?

What is half of a dozen plus two?

If you add 5 to me and then divide by 2, you get 6. What number am I?
